oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Head Elementary School, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1959, Vol. 2 p. 150
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Head Elementary School, located at 500 20th Avenue North. The school was built 1953 and named in honor of J.M. Head, Mayor of Nashville from 1899-1903, and the original school, constructed in 1904, was located on 16th Avenue North. The new school at 20th Avenue North was built in 1953 to accommodate gradesw one through six, and the old building was torn down to make way for the John Henry Hale Homes. Currently known as Head Math and Science Magnet School, it is located on Jo Johnston Avenue. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1959. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
